result.execSummary:
The defendant Deontae D Johnikin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 58 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deontae D Johnikin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. spc
Letter from DOC requesting review of the defendant's sentence credit.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 58 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.  STRAIGHT TIME.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.  Court allows for dosage probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 8 MONTHS condition time with Huber & Day Reporting Center.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court via telephone, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests  more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court orders $500 cash bail with all previously ordered conditions of bail.

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court via telephone, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court does not object to Branch 35 taking this case for global resolution.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense attorney is ill and requests a short adjournment.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Deontae D Johnikin not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing, however defense attorney is leaving the State Public Defender's office.  Defendant wishes to adjourn to discuss sentencing and open case in Branch 35 with new attorney before moving forward.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status of counsel scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Katie Seelow for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Ineligibile Voting Notice and Acknowledgement filed and received. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed and received.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol (post-rotation).  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Due to the Court's calendar and a emergency in the defendant's family, the Court adjourned the plea and sentencing.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered Count 1 amended to Possession of Narcotic Drugs, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.41(3g)(am) and 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.   

Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Chelsee Bates.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing on July 21, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 3.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Court is in trial.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/21/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point violation report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/11/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders defendant to continue with Justice Point.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
State to provide offer to defense.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/4/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Deontae D Johnikin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
